result.execSummary:
The defendant Dameon Lee Hendricks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers or locations where drugs are present, used, traffiked or stored including vehicles.
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Set up a trust for his money to go into so he has someone controlling that money so he doesn't squander it.

DNA sample.

Credit for 26 days if probation revoked.
.

supervisions.notes: Can be served on EM through JSS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dameon Lee Hendricks

9:15 am Def in court w/ Atty Sasa G Johnen.  Def in custody.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands
Possession of Narcotic Drugs  (Fel)  961.41(3g)(am) and 939.50(3)(i)   GUILTY
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.  No voting or firearms advised.  Possibility of deportation advised.  Victim righs act complied with.  No promises/threats to enter plea.  Mr. Hendricks states what happened that day.
COURT finds the plea is F, V & I made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
Minser:  The goal today is for rehab.  He's continued to struggle on bond.  First felony conviction.  Probation will give more strict control.  Conditions are appropriate.  Leaves the length to the court.  Johnen comments.  He'll receive a large sum of money if he finishes high school.  He has a 4 month old son.  He recognizes he needs help.  Asks for expungement.  Minser has no position on expungement.  Court addresses Mr. Hendricks
SENTENCE withheld
18 mos probation
Any assessments or evaluations deemed appropirate by agent and follow through with any recommendations
AODA and comply with any recommendations
No alcohol or controlled substances w/o Rx from a Dr
Random testing to ensure abstinence
No contact with anyone known to be a drug user or dealer
Not be in any location where drugs are present, used, traffiked or stored including vehicles
Complete GED or HSED
Set up a trust for his money to go into so he has someone controlling that money so he doesn't squander it.
DNA sample
CC and DOC fees
Expungement  973.015 treatment is probation is successfully completed
Jail credit tbd

9:30 am Def in court w/ Atty Sasa G Johnen.  Def in custody.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JSS violations and n/a at status hrg.  Minser:  Back on 9/12 and 9/17, Mr. Waterman appeared.  Mr. Hendricks didn't give proof of his prescriptions.  Johnen knows there was an issue with documentation.  Mr. Hendricks is trying to get that documentation.   I was just appoitned lat week and don't have the info yet.  Asks for a $500 cash bond  He' ssat 13 days now.  He understands the importance of testing.
COURT:  Part of the problem is that the last order to detain: the positive tests and missed tests are ongoing.  It's been 6 weeks now... 
$500 cash bond w/ same conditions.  If he posts, he'll have to come in at 11 am tomorrow and provide a valid prescription or you'll go back into custody.
